SEARCH
Package risk.common.persistence

Schnittstelle PersistenceManager

Alle bekannten Implementierungsklassen:
FilePersistenceManager
public interface PersistenceManager
Defines the persistence operations for player data management.

This interface outlines methods for saving and loading player data to and from a file. Implementations of this interface should provide the logic for serializing a list of Player objects to a file and deserializing them back into a list of Player objects from the file. This is crucial for maintaining game state across sessions.

  • Methodendetails

    • speicherPlayer

      boolean speicherPlayer(List<Player> players, String filename) throws Exception
      Saves a list of Player objects to a specified file.

      This method serializes a list of Player objects into a string format and writes them to the specified file. Each Player object is converted to a string using its toString method and then written to the file, with each player entry separated by a specific delimiter for readability. The method ensures that all player data is accurately saved, allowing for the persistence of game state across sessions.

      If the operation is successful, the method returns true. If an exception occurs during the write operation, the method catches the exception, logs it, and returns false, indicating the failure of the operation.

      Parameter:
      players - The list of Player objects to be saved.
      filename - The name of the file where the players' data will be saved.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the players were successfully saved, false otherwise.
      Löst aus:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the writing process.

    • loadPlayers

      List<Player> loadPlayers(String filename) throws IOException
      Loads a list of Player objects from a specified file.

      This method deserializes player data from a given file into a list of Player objects. It reads the file line by line, parsing the data according to the expected format and instantiating Player objects with their attributes set accordingly. The method is designed to handle errors gracefully, throwing an IOException if any issues occur during file reading.

      The expected format for player data includes detailed information about each player, such as their name, ID, and the state of their game entities (e.g., units, countries). This method ensures that all necessary data is accurately parsed and that each Player object is correctly constructed and added to the list to be returned.

      Parameter:
      filename - The path to the file from which player data will be loaded.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Player objects, each representing a player's data loaded from the file.
      Löst aus:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the file.
